tool.name: HeatMapsAdaptSearch
tool.description: Builds heatmaps based on MutCount (concatenated mode) results

param.name: input
param.label: Table
param.help: csv file with counts and frequencies of codons, amino-acids, or amino-acids types (outputs of MutCount in 'concatenated' mode)

param.name: tree
param.label: Newick tree computed by ConcatPhyl (RAxML best tree)
param.help: The tree is used to order the species in the heatmap

tool.help:
@HELP_AUTHORS@
**Description**
This tool display, on heatmap(s), the results of codons/amino-acids/amino-acids types counts and frequencies computed by The tool MutCount (in concatenated mode)
--------
**Parameters**
- Table : one a csv file computed byt the tool 'MutCount' in 'Concatenated mode' : codons_freqs.csv, aa_freqs.csv, or amino_acids_types.csv - Newick tree : a phylogentic tree in Newick format, computed by the tool 'ConcatPhyl' (which calls RAxML). If you import the tree with 'Get Data', you may have to specify the datatype 'nhx' or convert it afterwards. - What to plot : you can choose to plot only counts or frequencies (one output file), or both (two output files)
--------
**Outputs**
One or two heatmaps (counts / frequencies) with species in lines (ordered as they appear in the phylogenetic tree) and codons/amino-acids/types of amino-acids in columns. Columns are ordered along the types of amino-acids.
---------
